means: 耕( plow的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A train plowed into the barrier at the end of the platform.
sentence.Network_cn: 火车撞上了月台尽头的栅栏。

sentence.Network_en: The plane had plowed a path through a patch of forest before coming to rest in a field.
sentence.Network_cn: 飞机猛冲过一片森林，在一片田野中停了下来。

sentence.Network_en: They plowed nearly 100,000 acres of virgin moorland.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们犁了将近10万英亩未开垦的高沼地。

PerfectNetExp.abs: NIV They make many promises , take false oaths and make agreements ; therefore lawsuits spring up like poisonous weeds in a plowed field .[和合]他们为立约说谎言，起假誓；因此，灾罚如6苦菜滋生在田间的犁沟中。
He plowed through his exams ., 他费力地通过了考试.
the rough texture of plowed fields ., 犁过的田地的不平表面.
they found that the first two and a half centimeters of topsoil are up to seven times stronger against rain than plowed soil .他们发现，免耕土壤表层2.5厘米厚的表土抗雨水侵蚀的能力比传统耕作土壤强7倍。
